newsitem.title: USA: U.S. sells 1.075 mln barrels SPR oil for $22.9 mln.
newsitem.headline: U.S. sells 1.075 mln barrels SPR oil for $22.9 mln.

text.p: The U.S. government on Thursday sold 1.075 million barrels of oil from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve to three refiners for a total of $22.9 million, the Energy Department said.
The average price for the sour crude was $21.33 per barrel.
Texaco Trading was awarded two 200,000 barrel batches at $21.32 and $21.22 per barrel respectively for pipeline delivery in December.
Salomon Inc's Basis Petroleum won 375,000 barrels at $21.40 for tanker delivery in December or January.
Fina Oil and Chemical won 300,000 barrels at $21.31 for pipeline delivery in December or January.

Having sold 7.745 million barrels of crude over the last month, including Thursday's award, the Energy Department said it had raised 75 percent of its targeted $220 million to help trim the federal budget deficit.
New bids for the continuing auction are due December 2, after the U.S. Thanksgiving holiday weekend.
